direction.raw_text: . EXT. - NORTHWEST LANDSCAPES. DAY A grim region where the sky hangs low and the wind can knock a man off his feet. On the side of the highway, a large, muscular man with spiked blond hair: Ali Van Versh, 25. He has a big bag in one hand and a cell phone in the other. He talks on the phone as he continues walking:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's me. It's Ali... I left. I took the kid with me. She can't take care of him anymore. I got into a fight with the guy she's with. I don't know where to go. What do I do with the kid? I can't talk. I don't have any more credit... Call me back! He hangs up quickly and turns to Sam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Move it! His phone rings. He immediately answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah! Where is it? Shit! It's so far! How do I get there? I don't know. Today or tomorrow. Yeah... Ali lifts Sam onto his shoulders with one arm. Sam is tiny, he looks like a squirrel on his father's back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. TRAIN.DAY There is a map of the French rail system near the toilets in a regional train. While Sam pees, Ali examines it. He follows the lines to plot out their trip. He arrives where France ends, at the Mediterranean. Sam comes out of the bathroom, straightening his pants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm thirsty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't have any money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm thirsty!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. TGV. DAY A different speed, different countryside. Ali notices a half-empty bottle of Evian water left on a tray. He takes it. He searches through the garbage under other empty seats. Ali and Sam eat leftover sandwiches and fruit, and finish off abandoned bottles of water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. TGV. DAY Another TGV. Rain evaporates off the windows. Ali has fallen asleep. He's too big for his seat. Sam watches the landscape go by and bangs his feet against his seat. Ali opens one eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it. Sam's Mickey Mouse sandals pause, then go back to their banging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said to stop it. The sandals freeze. Cut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE CHILD All of a sudden, Sam is asleep, his eyelids blinking quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. CANNES STREET. DAY Ali's face is turned toward the orange heat of an afternoon sun. Ali and Sam look at the sea, the beaches and hotels. It's hot and beautiful. They walk by tanned people in shorts, short skirts, sandals... In their shapeless grey track pants, they look like hoboes. Ali drags his sport bag with one hand and Sam with the other. Ali is on the phone:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. A big street that started at the station. Yeah, by the beach. Behind? We just came from there! Ali pulls Sam away from one of the stairways that lead to the beach...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm tired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So am I. He's coming to pick us up. Come on! Sam is extenuated. Ali has to heave him up onto a shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. CANNES STREET. DAY A four-lane avenue near the outskirts of town. Ali is walking on the shoulder of the road, with Sam piggy- back. A horn beeps. A refrigerated truck, blinking to get to the side of the road. The window rolls down to reveal a moustache and a cap: Richard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. RICHARD'S TRUCK. DAY While driving...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Southern accent)... A couple miles back I saw a blond guy. (Imitates screeching brakes) I stop short! "You Ali?" I ask. He says "No, me Kurt". Another few hundred feet, another big blond guy! (Screech) I ask "You Ali?" again. This time I didn't even understand what he answered. Another few hundred feet... Ten of them! Ten! Every Kraut and Flemish guy on the coast! So I go call your sister... Ali is thrown for a loop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (uncertain) You kidding?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Ali) Is he a little crazy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Sam) What? You don't like my truck?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pretending to be shocked) He doesn't like my truck!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do too like it! Worked up, Sam shrieks, holding his hands over his ears:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (screaming) I like your truck! The road hugs the seashore. Ali watches beaches, homes, a railway line pass by... Voice over, we hear Richard's 5 distant voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SUBURBAN KITCHEN. DAY A kitchen with mismatched furnishings. China and cheesy wallpaper. Sam devours the cookies and Coke that Richard gives him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We all got fired after some Spanish guy bought out the trucking company... Eight truckers. I thought it over, discussed it with your sister and figured I could do it on my own. So I bought this truck with my severance pay... Ali has finished his cream cheese sandwiches. He gets up and opens the old fridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oops, poor man, not those! She'll kill you! Start with the expired ones, on the top shelf! They're organized by date. First the top shelf, then move down.... Anna brings it home from the supermarket where she works. As soon as they reach their expiration date, those idiots throw it all away, even if you can still eat it for a week! (to Sam) You want some more?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. SUBURBAN HOME. DAY Anna empties Sam's Spiderman bag onto the table, spilling out old, dirty, crumpled clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with a hint of Southern accent) Is this all you have for him? Anna Van Versh, Ali's sister, is in her thirties. She is a huge woman, very tall with a pretty face. She wears leggings that make her ass look like a workhorse's and a pair of flip flops. At the bottom of the bag, Anna finds a passport and opens it. It is Sam's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She remembered his passport!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She didn't remember anything. It was already in there. She forgot about it, that's all. When they went to Amsterdam, they'd use the kid to smuggle dope...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got to be kidding!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what she told me. Anna shakes her head in disbelief. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How will you tend to the kid? I won't be able to all the time. I work, and so does Richard... Was he in school there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know if your kid's in school?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, no. (turns to Sam) You in school? No answer. Sam is watching TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back at your mom's place, did you go to school?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can try to enroll him at the school. I'll see... We also need to get him some clothes. He can't go like that... I'll ask the neighbors. (gives the child her hand) Come with me to 7 the backyard. I have to feed my babies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. GARDEN. EVENING Evening is falling. At the back of the garden are a home- made pen and doghouse. Four puppies come running. Sam touches them through the chicken wire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to pet them? She lifts Sam up over the wire mesh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Careful. Don't step on their tiny paws. They're just babies. Anna shows him how to feed puppies, then stands back up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Ali) The breeder's picking them up next month. Brings in some money. Otherwise, Richard and I were thinking 300 a month for you and the kid... That okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Yeah" what? Is that too much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not too much, but I don't have it. I had to pay for the train...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what are you going to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Find a job. Whatever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, whatever... You think there's any work around here? You think there's any more here than there? Where has that ever been the case? When you told me you were coming down,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said we couldn't afford houseguests!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What should I have done with the kid? Where should I have gone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no idea, but if you stay here you have to pay your share, or else go somewhere else. As far as we're concerned, it's easy: we can't! How long were you thinking of staying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. She makes a tired gesture and goes back toward the house, calling Richard on the way. Ali hears Sam in the kennel, giggling in delight. He looks around: the seedy garden, a metal shed leaning to one side, what's left of an engine, an old, orange Special
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moped, plastic junk, etc. Overhead, a plane descends on Nice, its landing lights shining.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BASEMENT. NIGHT In the cluttered basement, Sam is rolled up in a sleeping bag arranged on a pallet and watches his father repair the antique Special 50 moped by the light of a flashlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. ELECTRONIC GOODS SHOP. DAY Ali wanders through an electronic goods shop, pretending to be interested in cameras. Through the shop window, he can see Sam waiting outside in the sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. ANTIBES STREETS. DAY Suddenly, Sam sees his father run out of the shop, trying to shake a security guard hot on his tail. Sam watches them disappear into a tiny lane. Sam looks around a bit frightened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Farther off, in a busy shopping districta Ali forces his way through hordes of tourists. The security guard grabs him by the hood and forces him up against a wall. They are both dripping with sweat and out of breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unzip your jacket! Empty your pockets! Ali keeps his cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unzip it yourself! Ali struggles free and smiles at the guy invitingly. The guard tries to punch him. Ali dodges: The guard hesitates a moment, until Ali lets fly a right hook. The guard stumbles. A kick in the face sends him flying into a stall. Ali lifts his arms in victory for the benefit of the few, stunned passersby. He kisses his own biceps, does three steps of a moonwalk and saunters off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. ANTIBES STREETS. DAY Sam is walking along the street by the beach amid the terraces and ice-cream stores, looking for his father. Then he sees the moped at the far side of the parking lot where they had left it chained up. He walks toward it. A voice calls out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Here I am! Ali crosses the street and kneels down in front of Sam who is sniffling, tears in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No need to cry. I wouldn't have left you all alone. Ali unlocks the moped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. ALLEYWAY. DAY In a small side street, Sam watches Ali sell a camera for a few 20 Euro notes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. ANTIBES - BEACH. DAY On the beach, Ali and Sam eat some McDonald's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you happy here? Sam nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you like the most at Auntie's?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dogs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that all? Nothing else besides the dogs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dogs and the truck. The house? Auntie? The ocean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dogs and the truck. Ali nods. Sam watches his Dad's fat fingers assemble the plastic toy from his Happy Meal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have it good here... Ali's fingers stop. Sam looks up to find his father watching some girls in swimsuits go by. They go for a swim, horsing around and making noise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. OFFICE - THE ALTA SECU COMPANY. DAY The logo is in the shape of a sheriff's badge and hangs over some filing cabinets on the wall of a modest office:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Securite".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No criminal record? You never fucked up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. The boss is in his fifties. He sits behind some files. His hair is short and white, it looks like he's wearing a helmet. He is squeezed into a cheap suit and wearing a tie. He stares at Ali.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that the truth? We'll be checking anyway... Ali nods. The owner reaches out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your papers... Ali hands him his tattered paper ID. The owner writes down the number. Ali is 13-14 on the picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was your last job?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I worked in a slaughterhouse. Not for long. It closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever work in security?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I was a night watchman in a stadium for 6 months. Working for the city. In a parking lot too. I did replacements.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever do any combat sports?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Karate, for 6 years. I even won Junior Division. And two years of boxing. Thai.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gave it up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was my trainer who gave up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He died. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how are you physically? You stay in shape?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't smoke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drink? He shakes his head "no". The boss notes something in a file.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. ALTA SECURITY OFFICE. DAY. Anna and Sam are waiting outside the office. The owner kisses Anna on the cheek. He asks how Richard is doing, then shows them to the door. Anna looks proud to know him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. FEVER RAY. NIGHT Saturday evening. The door to the Fever Ray night club. Patrons wait, bouncers pick and choose. An imposing Caucasian maneuvers the red rope. Behind him, Ali Van Versch and Foued Latahoui, who looks like a lightweight boxer, guard the door. Ali wears a faded blue "ALTA Secu" jacket and stiff, matching pants. Looking well-groomed, Foued is wearing a white shirt and tie. Well-groomed. A group of girls passes through the security barrier. Foued acts like he's hesitating:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, I'll let you through because I'm outnumbered. Four against one, I don't stand a chance! The girls smile and disappear inside. Ali watches them vanish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You say something nice, anything. That way, when they leave, they remember you and you can hit on them. If they're a little plastered, if things didn't go too well for them, you're there with a nice thing to say...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And it works?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes. But you can't be dressed like that. Like a parking lot attendant... They are interrupted by the bouncer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pointing) Fight! They go running. Three guys are fighting like savages. Ali and Foued clean house. Foued gets rid of gawkers. Ali delivers a few random punches, lifts one of the guys off
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: his feet and grabs another by the collar. While Foued chases the rowdy men toward the parking lot, Ali helps a girl back to her feet. She's a pretty blond, must be about 27 or 28, who has taken a punch in the face. It is Stephanie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay? Breathe out of your mouth. In and out. Put your head back. Walk a little. Walk and breathe... He demonstrates how and takes her by the arm, forcing her to walk. She looks groggy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to go home...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have friends here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I came alone. I have my car in the lot. I'll be fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't drive like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine. I'm fine, I said. Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't drive like that. I'll call you a cab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do I get my car afterwards? Seriously, I'll be fine. Trust me! We hear a voice from the parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bitch! Stephanie looks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... you, you cunt. Bitch! She ignores him, pretending not to see him. She then notices the blood stains on her T-shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's your car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. STEPHANIE'S CAR. NIGHT Ali drives. His head seems to touch the roof of the little Fiat and his thighs are too thick for the seat. He glances over at Stephanie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still bleeding? Keep your head back. Wait... He manipulates the knob to push her seat back. He grimaces in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you hurt yourself? He shows her his right wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's swelling up. He rests his hand on the wheel. After a beat:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You often go to the Fever?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you go alone? No answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To dance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To find a guy? She turns and looks down her nose at him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're dressed like that just for dancing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How am I dressed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know... Look. He points to her skirt, riding up her thighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, so what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look like a hooker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How would you call it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe this. Pull over here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop this car on the double!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No reaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's MY car! If I tell you to stop, you stop! Still no reaction, as if she hadn't said a thing. She is about to scream again, but remains silent, although open- mouthed. She finally settles back down on the back of her seat and looks elsewhere. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dressed like that, it's no surprise that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's enough now! They ride in silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SIMON & STEPHANIE'S BUILDING. NIGHT The Fiat stops in front of a small building in a flowery residential neighborhood. They climb out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How will you get back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. She takes out her wallet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, stop!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a taxi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. Got any ice at your place? He shows her his wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ice cubes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait, I'll go check.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can come up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Even she is surprised by the brusqueness of her response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (embarrassed) Someone's up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait here. I'll be right back. She takes a few steps, fumbling for her keys. She hesitates, then looks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, come on up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. SIMON & STEPHANIE'S APARTMENT. NIGHT They enter the apartment. The light is on. Simon comes out of the bedroom in his boxer shorts and a T-shirt. He's thirty, blond, and there is something commanding about his look that could be thought to resemble Stephanie's. He discovers Ali and the blood stains on Stephanie's T- SHIRT:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell? What's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. A fight...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'm fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pointing to Ali) Who's he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bouncer from the Fever. He drove me home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (introducing himself)... Ali.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Fever? What the hell were you doing there? Ali opens the refrigerator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you looking for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ice cubes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hurt his hand... Simon pulls Stephanie into the bedroom. Ice cubes in a Plexiglas salad bowl. Ali's hand in the bowl. He looks around. There are photos on the wall: Stephanie surfing on the back of a killer whale, Stephanie posing with a group of young people in diving suits in front of the Marineland logo, Stephanie rising out of the water on Niska's rostrum, etc. From the nearby bedroom, he hears snatches of Simon's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you decide to go out, call me. That's all! Who were you with there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Philippe and Christine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you went out to dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We decided to go out for a drink after.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get my text messages? Why didn't you answer me? Stephanie comes back into the kitchen. She has changed her T-shirt. She seems tense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Feeling better?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that you in the picture with the orcas?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not orcas. Just one orca. Her name is Niska.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that your job?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yep... Ali nods vaguely admiringly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck... I didn't think that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That what? A whore could train whales? Well, you see... Simon is at the door. He is wearing a jean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (To Ali) Okay, are you done now? Can you leave us alone? Ali stares him down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You talking to me? It's as if Ali's calm, peremptory tone suddenly let Simon know who he was dealing with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing, forget it... In one second, Stephanie sees Simon's face undergo a metamorphosis, his nervous authority suddenly disappear. She glances at Ali as if to say a Please go now.' He gets up and wipes his hands on a dish rag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, I'm going. So long. (pointing to a piece of paper on the table) I left you my number if ever you need it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. SIMON & STEPHANIE'S APARTMENT - BATHROOM - NIGHT She dissolves an aspirin in a toothbrush glass. She checks her lip in the medicine chest mirror. She notices Simon watching her from the bathroom doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay? Are you upset?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm not upset. She drinks the aspirin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw your face before...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With that guy who dropped me off. I saw your face. I saw how you piped down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I piped down? Me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, you piped down... (pause) Don't tell me what I should do, how I should live my life. Don't give me any more orders, Simon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does that mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't give me any more orders, that's all. She turns on the faucet and runs her lips under the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MARINELAND. TRAINERS' OFFICE. DAY Two rooms adjoining the locker room. Two desks, and on the walls pictures of the trainers with their orcas, laminated posters of various training methods, files for each animal. Stephanie is in her diving suit, sitting in front of Louise, a 23-year-old woman who is reading a document about her internship. A trainer leaves the locker room, his backpack slung over his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming? No answer. Tension. He leaves without a word. Louise looks up. She has been crying. Stephanie looks at her, impassive. Louise swallows her tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really... this isn't fair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Louise, there are lots of things you can say but not that. The pools are my responsibility and all I care about are the animals. I have to see to their environment and that starts with their trainers. Do you understand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you trying to make me believe, that I wasn't up to par?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lacking in maturity? Skills?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not consistent. We've already discussed that. The foundation of the relationship with the orcas is stability. During your internship you've had your ups and downs. It's not your competence that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know this has nothing to do with my internship. You couldn't care less if I was competent or not! It has to do with that I fucked Michael. Just say so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, please...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And in fact what really bothers you is not that we fucked, but that he told me about you. How you think you're so... How you've become such a bitch. That's why you're firing me. That's what you should write in your report.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, are you done? We can stop here. No need to spoil the rest of your internship. Louise stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. MARINELAND. POOL - DAY The empty stadium above the pool. The trainers walk along the gangplanks busily. In her diving suit, Stephanie leans over the "beach" of pool 3. She taps on the surface of the water. A wave forms, whirling around the pool. The whale washes up on the "beach" beside her. She performs what looks like a daily ritual. She examines the whale, caresses it. The whale responds with uncanny gurgles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. MARINELAND. DAY Stock shots of a show at Marineland, or images which we will film to resemble stock shots: wide-angle shots from the stadium. The sound equipment blares "Jump" by Van Halen, orcas shoot out of the water, the audience applaudsa Little kids clutch electric-blue dolphin balloons, getting splashed by the orcasa Images of the show are relayed on giant video screens, orcas shoot by like torpedoes behind the plastic protective wall in front of the main pool, etca
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MARINELAND POOL. DAY All at once, silence. Then surface noise, but muted by the cubic meters of watera Underwater shots from pool number 3. Overhead, the surface shines like a mirror. In pool number
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a five-ton black shadow bides its time: it is Niska. Behind the grate in pool number 3, Niska watches her mates diving and surfacing in a spray of bubbles. A mechanical creak, then the grate slowly begins to lift. It's about to be her turn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Niska swims into the big pool, slowly at first, but then picks up speed. She surfaces, disappears for a long beat, then again reappears, churning up a whirlpool of bubbles. On the other side of the mirror, the music blares and the crowd cheers. What looks like a small black and white arrow dives into the pool. We recognize Stephanie. She caresses Niska's rostrum, then kisses it, hanging onto her fins, waltzing with her up to the surface. Her hands look ridiculously tiny on the huge black fins. We see her face mirrored in one of the orca's huge black, gentle eyes. A liquid world of greens and blues whirls around them. Now, with her legs slightly arched on the rostrum, Stephanie has Niska swim around the pool, accelerating the water pressure and speed. The plastic wall rushes by, a rush of adrenalinea clouds of sediment are lifted as if by a gust of wind. A young male, Tom, joins Niska in pool number 1. Niska immediately rushes him, as if riled by the intrusion, and flattens him against the plastic wall. In the shifting reflections at the water's surface, we can make out Stephanie and two other trainers' faces on the a beach'. Their palms beat on the water, summoning the orcas for their next number. Tom gathers some momentum, then shoots around Niska to jump into first place. He disappears a moment, then is back into the water after a dozen meters of aquaplaning. Niska then gets into place and takes a running start, but just as she is about to shoot out of the water, Tom appears out of nowhere and forces the huge female to leap over him. We sense chaos up above. Then we see Niska crash back into the water, with, one after the other, a piece of the huge video screen that towered over the stage, bits of scenery, and all kinds of random objects, as if Niska had carried away half the platform in her wakea It all seems to fall in slow motion, like flecks of snow in a snow globe. Something sinks toward usa a body, floating weightless and disjointed in a cloud of red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. MARINELAND - WHALE POOL. DAY Stephanie is on the rim of the pool. All around her: the audience panics, a loudspeaker orders evacuation, Louise leans over her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What... What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom and Niska... They got in each other's way. Then Louise sees blood spurting from the rips in her diving suit. She tries to find a pressure point. Stephanie sees Louise's face wet with tears:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it, calm down. I'm fine! Her hand searches for something at thigh level, without finding it. She faints.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. ROAD TO THE BEACH. DAY Ali is wearing his MP3 headset. He runs down the road to the beach, sweat dripping into his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. ANNA'S HOUSE. DAY Sam's toys are lying scattered in the garden, his half- eaten snack is on the table. Ali takes off his headset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam! No answer. There is some noise over at the kennel. He goes and finds Sam in the kennel, talking to the puppies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam jumps and scuttles to the back of the kennel, but Ali reaches in and grabs him by the arm. Sam is covered in mud, straw and dog shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're gross! You stink! Who's taking care of you? Ali drags him over to the garage to hose him down. The water is freezing cold. Sam hops from one foot to the other and screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it, Dad! It's cold. Stop! Sam shrieks. An 18 year old tomboy wearing a skimpy tee- shirt comes out of a neighboring house: Joelle, the neighbors' daughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't you supposed to be taking care of him? What the fuck are you up to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was next doing the laundry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take a look at him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll put him in the shower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Sam, crying) Don't go in there. It's disgusting. You hear? Joelle takes Sam and disappears inside. Ali is drawn to the living room, when through the half-open door he notices the flat screen turned onto a news channel. Onscreen and behind the anchorwoman, he recognizes an inset photo of Stephanie, the same he saw at her place, riding on the back of a killer whale. iiiiii...iiiiiiSiiiiZiiiiiiiiSiiS Il manque une phrase
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was an accident at Marineland. Ali answers without taking his eyes off the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know her. Sam pulls off his towel. He watches his father who is riveted to the screen, glued to the looping footage of the accident.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. HOSPITAL - NURSES' LOUNGE. NIGHT Silence. The silence of an on-duty nurses' lounge: a table, a microwave on a mini-fridge, and Louise, standing by the window sipping coffee. She is wearing a fleece jacket, her hair messily pulled back. She hasn't had any sleep. She hears a scream. She rushes into the corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. HOSPITAL ROOM. NIGHT Chaos. Louise rushes into the room. She finds Stephanie crawling on the floor, dragging her IVs. She hesitates, overwhelmed, then calls for help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help! Help! Please! On the linoleum, two stumps stick out of Stephanie's nightshirt: two thick bandages surround her thighs that look like two wrapped hams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My legs! What did you do with my legs? Two nurses arrive. Stephanie is back in bed, the IVs in her arms. Louise rocks her gently. Stephanie's eyes struggle against sleep. She wants to scream again, but doesn't have the strength. She
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: falls asleep in Louise's arms. She feels eight years old. Black.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. HOSPITAL ROOM. DAY/NIGHT A series of scenes, day and night, fade into one another, always from the same POV. In the foreground, looking our way, is Stephanie's face and, behind, the visitors who succeed one another. Stephanie's eyes are shut. She opens them: - The other trainers from Marineland, holding bouquets. They are silent and look devastated. They occasionally speak to each other in whispers. Stephanie closes her eyes. Black. Stephanie opens her eyes: - Louise is seated nearby
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I stopped by your place. I saw the cleaning woman. She didn't want me to pay her. She was... in shock. She's scared to come here. She sends her regards. She closes her eyes. Black. She opens them. - A blonde, pretty woman in her fifties is sitting behind Stephanie, her face is close to hers. It is her mother. She speaks with a slight accent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I spoke to your brothers. They wanted to talk to you but I didn't think it was the right time. We'll all come with Hugo during the next school break... I was afraid I might lose you. I don't know what I'd have
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: done... It may seem selfish. In any case, you've always done whatever you wanted. But this time I was so scared that I don't think I'll ever be scared again. Her eyes close. Black. Her eyes reopen. The surgeon and his assistants. The orthopedist and his assistants. Her eyes close. Black. Her eyes open. - Simon is there, looking stiff and ill at ease. He tries not to make any noise as he puts a bunch of keys on the night stand. He leans over and kisses her hair. Her eyes close. Black. It's her mother again, but this time accompanied by a tall, uncomfortable looking blond teenage boy. She leans over to kiss her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in German) Hugo wanted to say goodbye to you. We're leaving tomorrow but we'll pray for you, honey. Her eyes remain open. Black.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. MARINELAND. NIGHT The bluish light at the bottom the main pool at Marineland. A diver is raking its bottom, wiping away sludge composed of micro algae, paint chips and fish bones. He examines the replacement mud and then, inside the drain, the mud being replaced. He digs his hand into the sediment and feels something there. He surfaces and deposits his find on the rim of the pool: It is one of Stephanie's diving flippers, with her foot cut off at the ankle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. STEPHANIE'S NEW APARTMENT - BATHROOM. NIGHT Stephanie wakes up with a start in her handicapped bathtub. She tries to grab the bars but can't find them. She rolls over on herself like a floating log. She panics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. HOSPITAL - PHYSICAL THERAPY ROOM - EVENING There are several rows of parallel bars, with amputees hanging on to them as they relearn to walk with their prosthetics. Most of them are old. Nurses help them along. From her wheelchair, Stephanie watches, looking glum and as if at a great distance. Her hair is greasy and her face swollen by her medication and induced sleep. She looks through the big window that opens onto the exterior. Outside, amputees smoke and chat. She notices one group, livelier than the rest. At its center, a guy is smoking a cigarette he holds in a pincer in the place of his hand. His name is Gilles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. GILLES' CAR. EVENING Four of them are smoking a joint in Gilles' Megane. Outside, evening is falling over the convalescent center's parking lot. Stephanie is sitting up front. She passes the joint to Gilles, who takes it in his chrome pincer. She notices the scar that deforms his face and one side of his mouth. There is a couple in the backseat, making out: Raphael (his arms are missing and his sleeves are pinned up at his shoulders) and Julia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Stephanie) Want me to tell you something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You haven't finished mourning, that's all!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? Mourning who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mourning my legs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. He sounds as serious as a civics teacher. She looks at him, incredulous. Raphael sticks his head up front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pass me the joint... Gilles' pincer and joint go for Raphael's lips. He takes a long hit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were a part of you. When a man dies, he gets buried. There's a ceremony, a prayer... Now a piece of you ended up in a hospital trashcan without a prayer, without any time for meditation. A beat. She is dumbstruck. She cannot believe what she's hearing. In the backseat, Raphael exhales some smoke into Julia's open mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You have to think about it symbolically...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it's really symbolic...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know where my arm is. We buried it under a nice oak tree behind my house in the scrubland. My wife and kids came and we sang... Stephanie has a fit of the giggles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a bit vexed) You think I'm kidding?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's the grass. I'll stop... She laughs so hard she cries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit, it's a laugh riot up there. (to Gilles) Can you take us home? She looks back and, between the seats, notices the girl toying with Raphael's fly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm too beat. I'll take a nap, then go. (to Stephanie) How are you getting home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT/INT. HYPERBRICO. NIGHT A HyperBrico DIY store in an industrial zone in Cannes. Its windows shine in the night like an aquarium.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. HYPERBRICO. NIGHT Ali and Kadhi, a huge guard accompanied by a dog, make their rounds. They open doors with a magnetic key, each time recording their passage on electronic terminals. A bit before midnight, someone knocks at the main entrance. Ali goes to look. It's a guy in a leather jacket and baseball cap, with a backpack and a shoulder bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To come in. The guy takes out a card and presses it against the glass door: it's the business card of ALTA SECU, the security agency.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Kadhi, come here! Kadhi comes over and looks at the guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, okay... Are you Martial?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me your keys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's fine. The boss told me he was coming. He works for the company. Ali hands him the bunch of keys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. HYPERBRICO - AISLES. NIGHT Ali goes down an aisle looking for something and finally finds what he was looking for: a folding ladder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. HYPERBRICO - STOCK ROOM. NIGHT Martial has spread out his material in a stock room at the back of the store at the end of a corridor formed by palettes: precision tools, drills, electronic mini-cameras still in their wrapping, cases equipped with antennae, packs of batteries... A small radio is playing a night program on Radio Monte Carlo. Equipped with a small headlamp, Martial carefully cuts a hole in a cardboard box with his Leatherman scissors. He conceals a tiny camera inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ali arrives with the ladder over his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will this do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perfect. Put it down there. Martial climbs the ladder to place the box high on a shelf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imagine you're the manager of a big store like this and the union reps have been busting your balls. What do you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fire them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think that's how it works? What do you do before you fire them? He checks to make sure the lens is aligned with the hole, then checks the screen and reception on a small pocket monitor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, beforehand you try to see how long they spend in the restroom, if they take extra-long coffee breaks, smoke on the premises, steal from the stockroom, rip customers off with the sales receipts... When you know all that, you put the pressure on them and you fire the ones who don't leave. Can you give me a stroll down the aisle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A stroll?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walk down the aisle. No, further down, like you came out of that door there. Good, perfect... Ali twice passes within the camera's field of vision. Martial climbs down his ladder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, then I'll be getting back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on! Martial pulls a 10 Euro bill from a jacket pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take it. Angle on the bill in Ali's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. SUPERMARKET - SECURITY ROOM. NIGHT Ali is in the security room reading a kickboxing magazine. A small radio is playing a late evening program. Outside in the parking lot, Kadhi smokes while walking his dog. The dog takes its time. Ali watches Kadhi pull on the leash. Ali's cell phone rings. The screen reads a unknown'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Stephanie. Remember me? We met at the Fever. Ali is taken by surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... How are you doing? She sniggers. Her speech sounds slow and thick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what happened to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... I saw the papersa the news on TVa How are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sniggering) How do you think I am? A beat. Ali is at a loss to answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... normal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still a bouncer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, not really.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to get together?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but nights are tough. I'm a security guard now. Three nights a week.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm... crazy busy too. Every day and every night. I don't know how to manage... A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. ANTIBES - INDUSTRIAL ZONE AND STREETS - DAWN The Speciale 50 putt-putts in the early morning light. Ali drives through a neighborhood of chain stores, Conforama,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Courtepaille, Leroy-Merlin...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. STEPHANIE'S RESIDENCE - DAY A gated community made up of four story buildings, lawns, bougainvillea and lavender. It looks pretty as a picture and squeaky clean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. STEPHANIE'S APARTMENT. DAY The door opens automatically. He is surprised. He hears a tired voice from inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in. She is waiting in her wheelchair, holding the remote control. She activates it and the door closes behind Ali. Her hair is mid-length, her face has thickened and there are bags under her eyes. She is wearing a baggy Nike T- shirt with burn marks here and there and a pajama bottom whose legs hang limp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you been waiting long?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... I just got here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was that you who rang before? She looks exhausted but feverish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in. Sit down. He sits down on a small couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Want something to drink? A coffee?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I only have instant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's fine. It takes two tries to activate the wheels on her wheelchair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Need any help? She answers with a growl, as much for him as for her wheelchair, then goes into the kitchen. He sees her pajama legs flap like rags, he hears the noise of the tap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you been living here long?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know... Three or four months.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking around)... It's nice. She comes back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you alone? You got no one to help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me what? Walk?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, for the cleaning and everything...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah there are people. They come and go. Hold on. She manages to navigate from the living room into her bedroom. He stays in the living room. He hears a kettle whistle in the kitchen. He goes into the kitchen and pours water into the glass/mug. He finds her hunched over in her
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wheelchair. She is nodding off, high on her medication.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, are you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine. He opens the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does it stink here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's me. He opens the curtains and looks outside. It is getting hot out. The automatic sprinklers have gone on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go out. (No answer) Hey, you hear me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get dressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave me alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are your clothes? He opens the closet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. STEPHANIE'S RESIDENCE - DAY When they come out of the building's lobby, the sun hits him on the head like a bad hangover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here. Ali hands her a pair of sunglasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where should we go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. You're the one who wanted to go out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should we go to the ocean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care. He tries to push the wheelchair, but she stops him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it. I want to puke. He notices that his moped is attached in the middle of a sprinkler area. He goes to free it and gets splashed... Heavy chain, padlock... he comes back with soiled hands. When he comes back, she's gone. He sees the wheelchair moving toward the seafront avenue. He goes to join her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SIDEWALK CAFE - DAY They are sitting at a table on a terrace facing the beach. They remain silent. She looks at his huge fists, black with axle grease.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to go in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel like swimming!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't want to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't feel like swimming? She looks daggers at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have a bathing suit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you realize what you're saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who the fuck cares? There's no one here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it. He wavers a moment, then finally crosses the seafront avenue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. PRIVATE BEACH. DAY Stephanie is at the top of the steps in her wheelchair. Ali is talking with the beach boy when he notices her. Ali and the beach boy carry her to the deck chair area. Ali rents the whole shebang: parasol, beach towel, deck chair and a small tube of sunscreen 50. Sheltered under a parasol, she pancakes her face with cream and watches him dive in, wearing his boxers, and noisily and clumsily crawl some laps. His body is pink and white. Huge and buff. Then she looks out to sea, the listless waves washing in and out. The fresh feel of it all makes
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: her want to drink it all in. He comes back, enthusiastic and dripping wet. She looks around. The beach is deserted, other than for a far off, elderly couple broiling in the sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually I think I will go in. He looks at her. She covers herself with a towel and wiggles out of her pants, revealing what remains of her legs. Her stumps are white, with terrible scars at their extremities.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to carry me. Help me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (makes a gesture)... How, like this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. He lifts her up and carries her to the water. He takes her far enough in until she begins to float.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't let me go! Not right away... Do it gently. She feels unsure of herself. He lets go of her gradually. She starts to sink, then crawls forward, with power and grace. She stops but has to paddle like a dog to tread water. He joins her. She grabs onto him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't stop. If I do, I sink. Wait... She gesticulates...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is bothering me! She takes off her T-shirt and hands it to him. Her breasts press against Ali's chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, you can let go. She lets herself go and crawls like a pro. He stays put, holding her t-shirt. Twenty-five meters later, her head emerges. He hears a burst of laughter. Half asleep in a deck chair, he looks up from time to time to see how she's doing. She calls out to him. She is sitting in the water. She motions for him to come and get her. He helps her out and takes her into his arms. She hangs on to him, still out of breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You swim like a real pro!... She shuts her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck that's good! The beach is crowded now. Ali carries her back to the deck chairs. Some bathers watch them go by, others look away. They are stretched out in their chairs. She has wrapped her lower body in a beach towel. They sunbathe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She rolls onto her back. He sees her breasts pointed heavenward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. GYM. DAY A decrepit, simple, functional, but reasonably clean workout room. Guys of every color work the punching bags, lift weights, do chin-ups... From the gym next door, we hear the booming music of an aerobics class. In a small ring at floor level, Ali and Foued, loaded down with protective gear, pound each other. Each of their blows lands right on target. They repeat the same series of moves several times at varying speeds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. GYM - CORRIDOR. DAY Ali and Foued are dripping wet. They have towels around their necks. They fill their small plastic bottles at a faucet in the workout room. Through a large window in the corridor, Ali watches the aerobic class going on in the gym: legs and feet moving in rhythm, red faces, sweaty underarms, butts, boobs and the braid of the instructor, who uses it to beat the measure, as she swings it from one shoulder to the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to get back. I need to train. Ali nods, without actually looking at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. GYM - STREET. DAY Outside, Ali has unwrapped the sandwich his sister had prepared for him. A bit farther off, the aerobics instructor is smoking in the sun. She has a short, buff body. She smokes her cigarette like someone who counts them out sparingly. They remain like that a while, he chewing ands she smoking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. GYM - EQUIPMENT ROOM. DAY A cell phone vibrates. Through a narrow transom, a ray of sun slices through the dark equipment room. They haven't bothered undressing. Ali and the aerobics instructor are making love on a pile of workout mats. Ali's cell phone continues to vibrate, goes silent, vibrates again. He answers. We hear a crackling voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm still at the gym. I'm leaving... I said I'm leaving! He hangs up. They continue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NUSERY SCHOOL - SCHOOLYARD. DAY Sam is playing alone, perched up on monkey bars in the schoolyard. Through a wide window, he sees his father racing down a corridor that runs alongside the schoolyard. The principal is waiting for him at the door. Ali spurts out some quick apologies. Sam slowly slides off the structure. We hear the noise of his hands skidding on metal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT ANTIBES EVENING The moped wheezes and sputters. Ali and Sam are heading back home along the beach. Ali is so big, the moped looks like a kid's bike. Behind him on the luggage rack, he can feel Sam leaning into him. Sam's hand rummages in his coat pocket for a box of Choco-BN cookies. Ali takes one too. To their left, a train noisily speeds by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. STEPHANIE'S APARTMENT. DAY Louise has a set of keys. She enters Stephanie's apartment with the mail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steph! Made up and well-groomed, she looks older than she actually is. Stephanie answers from the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm in here! Louise puts the mail on the living room table and enters the bedroom. Stephanie wheels herself out of the bathroom, her hair wet and her body wrapped in a towel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit, you're not ready! The appointment is in a half hour!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's fine!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean? You're a freaking pain! I have to get back to work. Come on, let me help you. She grabs the arms of the wheelchair and pushes Stephanie toward the closet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let go of me! Stop, I can manage alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah? Okay, so manage then! She lets go of the wheelchair and leaves the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. STAPHANIE'S RESIDENCE. DAY Louise briskly pushes Stephanie's wheelchair across the residence garden. The warning lights on her 205 are blinking in front of the gate. Stephanie hangs onto Louise's neck. Louise lifts her out of her wheelchair as best she can and into the passenger seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louise bends down to buckle Stephanie's seat belt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (annoyed) I can do the seat belt! In front of the open trunk, Louise struggles to fold the wheelchair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't you call them to tell them we're going to be late?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. PROSTHESIST'S OFFICE. DAY In CU: the brochures of prosthetic manufacturersa we see pictures of the various models go by. Stephanie is in the doctor's office with Doctor Vitias. He is in his fifties and is wearing a white jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll order two pairs of prosthetic devices, one for everyday life and one for the sport you do. Stephanie pages through the various brochures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you have something simpler, classier?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean by classier?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know... like a wooden leg with a piece of rubber at the end?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling) No, sorry. We don't make those models anymore. Louise shuts her eyes, visibly exasperated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or just a plank. A plank with wheels and straps. And irons to move forward with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (furious) Can you cut it out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? If I want...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've had enough of your schtick, you hear me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up! Stephanie shuts up. Vitias still looks patient as Job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. PROSTHESIST'S OFFICE. DAY Sitting on an examination table, Stephanie waits for the resin bands wrapped around her stumps to dry. Louise is sitting on a stool across from Stephanie. Their eyes meet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go if you wanta I'll take a taxi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told them I was with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that works? If you tell them you're with me, do they let you do what you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cool. If ever you want a day off, just tell me. I'll write you a note. Louise looks at her. She's not going to let her get on her nerves. There is a knock at the door. A nurse enters. She checks the resin bands, looks at her watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: more minutes, just to make sure. Then Doctor Vitias will come for you. She smiles and closes the door. The two young women are again left alone. Stephanie stretches out her hand. Louise takes it. And they remain like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. HYPERBRICO - SECURITY ROOM - NIGHT In close up on the screen of a small DVD player: amateur images of two bare-chested guys fighting in the garden of a suburban house. It looks like a wild boxing match, free- for-all vale tudo in which anything goes. In the Bricorama security room, Ali, Kadhi and Martial, excited, are bent over the screen. A few blows to the face have one of the combatants KO on the lawn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at the next one! Watch how he whacks him. A change of scene on the small screen: a courtyard between two tower blocks, with new combatants, but with the same amateur images and the same violence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pointing to the screen)... I know him. I fought him twice in Nationals. He's not bad. He was at the boxing club in Marseille. Martial watches Ali, fascinated by the images, as if he were sizing him up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. PROJECTS. DAY An apartment in a Golfe Juan housing project. After-dinner time. Kids are playing, women doing the dishes. On the living room couch, under a tapestry of a lion hunt in Technicolor, Martial blows on his glass of tea. His
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: cousin is sitting across from him. Ali is on a stool at the end of the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says he's done Thai boxing. He can fight. He's enormous. He's not afraid of taking punches, and he's white.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see. The cousin turns to Ali. He takes his time sizing him up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that true? You like to fight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, so I organize the fights. I pick the fighters. I see if the money's there. I ref. I collect the dough... I take a third of the bets. The rest goes to the winner...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A third of how much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't fight for less than 800. Ali does the division in his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So? Ali hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Martial) There's something I don't get: how much do you take?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. You tell me. How much do you need? I'll take 20% of what you win. How's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how much does your cousin give you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I introduced you to him, didn't I? How's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. The cousin stands up. They all shake on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. LIVING ROOM. DAY Ali is in a corner of the living room, sitting in front of Anna's old PC and watching some fight videos he's found. Anna rushes into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep Sam with you for 5 minutes! She hurries to find some papers in the drawer of a commode. Ali hasn't budged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh! Hear me? I don't want your son in the garden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I heard. He gets up and goes to get Sam who is playing behind the house. Anna finds her papers and leaves in another direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam! Come here! I want to show you some stuff! He lifts Sam up with one arm and goes back to the computer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look how they fight... He clicks on an image and the fight continues... the audience's noise as well. Sam watches, intrigued. Ali
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: commentates, pointing to guys onscreen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at him, in red. See how strong he is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he the good guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, he's the bad guy. Look how he tries to grab his legs. Wait. His phone vibrates. He takes it from his pocket. It's Martial. He answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Yeah...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is the red one the bad guy? Daddy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Look and tell me who wins. He turns down the sound, settles Sam on the stool and gets up to go speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into the phone) So? What did he say? Which others? How many? Sam watches the fight in silence. Dogs bark in the garden. Sam feels something coming. He looks out the window, then goes running. Ali hasn't noticed a thing and continues his phone conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this bullshit? What do you mean, a tournament?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. ARAB CAFA. DAY Martial is leaning on the bar of a noisy Arab cafe/betting office, talking into his phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last one standing gets the money. I know, but he says it's better that way. Do you think you're in a position to negotiate a percentage? Where did you get that idea from? He gave me a website if you want to see the others. He takes out a small spiral notebook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. LIVING ROOM. DAY From the living room, Ali hears Sam screaming in the garden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him to give the website to his mother. All I see is me doing more fights and him making more dough. Ali goes to the window. Outside, near the kennel, Sam has lunged at a guy in a jumpsuit who is helping Anna get the puppies into a metal cage. Sam is screaming. Anna tries to take him into her arms. Sam clutches the bars of the cage. The puppies bark. Anna finally manages to rip Sam free and drag him back into the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into the phone) He's changing the rules and so am I... I couldn't care less. Anna storms into the living room. Sam is shrieking, having a tantrum. He kicks and bites.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm on the phone!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell? I asked you to watch him for 5 minutes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into the phone) I'll call you back. Ali hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Outside, the kennel keeper rolls the cage across the garden. Anna hugs Sam in her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Sam) He's taking them to the country. They'll be so happy there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave me alone. They're my babies! Sam refuses to calm down. Anna looks at her brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing? Are you his father or not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're such a pain in the ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't talk to me like that! Ali rips the child from his sister's grip. Sam struggles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it now! I said stop! Calm the fuck down!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let go of me! Let go! Sam kicks out. Ali shakes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut it out, dammit! You're such a pain! He flings the child away. Sam's head hits the coffee table. Silence. Anna rushes over and picks up Sam, who has stopped crying. He's been knocked out. Anna is frightened. She examines his scalp, she strokes his head. She trembles. A cut on his head begins to bleed. She kisses the wound. Ali comes over, upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't touch him! Don't touch him I said! You know what? You're... you're a bad person. Huddled against Anna's breasts, Sam opens his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. BEACH. DAY The day is over. The beach boy has already packed away most of his paraphernalia. In the water, Ali and Stephanie are out with some of the last swimmers. Faithful to what by now seems to have become a habit, he carries her piggyback to their lounge chairs. They come out of the water in the middle of a discussion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of boxing? Thai? Do you use your feet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, just fists I think. We bash each other's faces and whoever's still standing at the end wins. Hey, you're strangling me! He puts her down on her chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it the first time you're doing this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you're not scared?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much do they pay you for this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. About 500, 1000 maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're doing that for 500 euros?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to get whacked on the face and risk your health for 500 euros?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Risk my health? What are you talking about? Why are you getting so worked up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll give you the 500! Cancel it and I'll give it to you tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can give it to me if you have too much money, but I said I was doing it and I am. That's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it's not for money, why then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't say it's not for the money!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you doing it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, stop driving me crazy! I'm doing it to fight. For fun. Why did you clown around on your fish? For the fun of it, right? She grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah and look how I ended up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spare me. You turn on the waterworks when you feel like it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She dries her eyes. He begins to pack things up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your fight, if you do it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mm?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I can come along?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT/INT. MARTIAL'S MERCEDES. DAY A narrow road. Down below, a town. The Mercedes Vito with the tinted windows lifts a cloud of dust. Stephanie is in the back seat and has to hold on to the overhead strap to avoid hurting herself. At the end of the road is a gate guarded by two huge homies. They signal Martial to over. He rolls down his window and the two homies peer inside. They see Ali and Stephanie in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His girlfriend. Surprised, Stephanie looks at Ali, watching for his reaction. He looks elsewhere. The gate opens. Martial drives in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT / INT. MARTIAL'S MERCEDES. DAY Ali and Stephanie are alone in the car. Through the tinted windows, they can see a concrete yard with boats dry-docked around it and buildings with satellite dishes studding every balcony. Some men are over in one corner, discussing: Martial, his cousin and some other mean looking guys. In the shade, a bit to one side and surrounded by his fans, is a bare-chested, muscle-bound North African. He warms up,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wagging his head from left to right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (under his breath) Motherfucker's acting like he's on Canal Plus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are the other guys?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Guys with money. Dealers. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great. Martial comes back with a wad of banknotes and slides into the passenger seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. Let's go. Fall against the big one in black shorts. I told you. They're big guys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. And the bets? How much is there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little over 2000 for the time being. But it'll go up during the final match.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do I do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No girls. Stay in the car. (To Ali) You ready? Ali nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. PROJECTS COURTYARD. DAY The blazing sun is melting the asphalt. A coin bounces between pairs of basketball shoes. The cousin picks it up. He points to Ali and the guy in the black shorts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and you. Ali pulls off his T-shirt, staring down his adversary. Martial takes the T shirt and leans over to Ali.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you get into trouble, don't insist, just fall. Ali doesn't flinch. The cousin, the bettors and the other fighters move away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MARTIAL'S MERCEDES. DAY Stephanie watches the faces leaning over the balconies overhead. She hears the spectators' hostility and cheers. A circle has formed around the fighters. She sees the shadow, and only the shadow, of his opponent's fist barely miss Ali's face. Then things speed up. Ali uses his feet, knees and fists. When his opponent begins to totter to one side, Ali hangs onto him like a pit bull. When he falls, Ali pounds on his face with his fists and elbows. The a ref' has to enlist Cousin's help to pull Ali away. Ali returns to his place in the car. Stephanie looks at him: he can't sit still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to go. Another combat begins, while Ali jogs around the hangar. Stephanie watches other combats, whether featuring Ali or not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She sees feet dancing on the concrete. She sees the banknotes in people's hands. She sees heads leaning over balconies. She sees an opponent's fist hit Ali behind the ear. She sees another of Ali's opponents get back to his feet, and Ali's fist split open his nose like a ripe fig. She sees another opponent's head bounce off the concrete. She sees a tooth roll across the concrete, like dice in a crap game. She sees Ali perform three steps of a moonwalk and kiss his own biceps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. ROAD. DAY A cloud of dust, a narrow, bumpy road. Martial's car is headed for the town below.
direction.name: direction
